title: Youth urged to play positive roles in politics
text:
Politics | 3 October 2015 11:00 CET Youth urged to play positive roles in politics By GNA 
Sunyani, Oct. 2, GNA - Naaba Abdul Salaam IV, newly installed Chief of Mamprusi in the Brong Ahafo Region, has urged Ghanaian youth to play positive roles in the political activities of the nation. 
He said if all Ghanaians, including the youth, did politics with good conscience and clean hearts, there would be no room for chaos and anarchy. 
Naaba Salaam gave the advice in an interview with the Ghana News Agency after his installation in Sunyani. 
He said politics should not be seen as a dirty game, but rather a means of shaping the destiny of a nation for the wellbeing of the people. 
'When we do clean political campaigns devoid of hate, insult and abject disregard for age and authority, we shall always have peaceful transitions from one party or government to another, without a single stone being thrown at even a bird, not alone a human being, ' he said. 
The chief advised politicians who used the youth to foment trouble to re-think the harm they caused to the future leaders and the entire Ghanaian society, and desist from such ignoble acts. 
'The era where the youth, especially those from the Zongo communities, were used to settle political scores should be gone forever for the peace and progress of our dear nation,' he said. 
Mr Ibrahim Bukari, the Mamprusi Youth Chairman, said the youth of today were more alert and enlightened than before, so unscrupulous politicians should not take them for granted. 
He said politics was not for war, but an arena where issues of national concerns and development were addressed. 
Mr Bukari urged the Zongo youth to debunk the notion of being noted for rowdiness, and show the world that they were indeed peace-loving and law-abiding citizens. GNA
